p.d: 1936. During the Popular Front, Milou, a young boxer, discovers France's haute bourgeoisie via his mentor, Johnny, a friend of the Ancelot family. Quickly accepted by them, Milou becomes the lover of Mariette Ancelot and Christine Lasquin, from a leading business family. He soon abandons boxing to take up writing. Directed by: Gérard Jourd'hui (France, 2014) Screenplay: Gérard Jourd'hui, Anne Andrei, based on Marcel Aymé Cast: Christophe Aléveque, Thierry Frémont, Marie Bunel, Thomas Chabrol, Bérengere Krief, Laurent Spielvogel, Emmanuelle Galabru, Sébastien Thiéry... Genre: comedy
